message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.MM, cs.DC 

Reasoning: 
1. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper is primarily concerned with slicing a radio access network (RAN) for serving two 5G use cases, i.e., enhanced mobile broadband (eMBB) and ultra-reliable and low latency communications (URLLC). The paper discusses the physical resource blocks (PRBs) orchestrated for bursty URLLC traffic in the time-frequency plane and formulates the problem of slicing a RAN enabling coordinated multi-point (CoMP) transmissions for multicast eMBB and bursty URLLC service multiplexing as a multi-timescale optimization problem. These topics are closely related to networking and internet architecture. 
2. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper discusses the problem of slicing a RAN for serving two 5G use cases, i.e., enhanced mobile broadband (eMBB) and ultra-reliable and low latency communications (URLLC), and formulates the problem as a multi-timescale optimization problem. These topics are closely related to information theory. 
3. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper discusses the problem of slicing a RAN for serving two 5G use cases, i.e., enhanced mobile broadband (eMBB) and ultra-reliable and low latency communications (URLLC), and formulates the problem as a multi-timescale optimization problem. These
